title: Ivan Rakitic stance on Man Utd transfer as Ole Gunnar Solskjaer eyes January spending spree
text:

Barcelona are reportedly willing to let central midfielder Ivan Rakitic move on in January, but the World Cup finalist is not thought to be keen on a move to Manchester United .

Following United's disastrous start to the season, which has seen them win just two Premier League games out of eight and slump to 12th place in the table, the board are preparing to back manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer with a spending spree in January.

The club allegedly have a list of seven potential signings they are keeping tabs on: Mario Mandzukic, John McGinn, James Maddison, Callum Wilson, Declan Rice, Moussa Dembele and Rakitic.

(Image: REUTERS)

But according to ESPN , a move for Rakitic could prove difficult because the player is not convinced by a move to England.

Despite being a key part of the first-team at Barcelona for five hugely successful seasons, Rakitic appears to be falling out of favour at the club, and with the summer signing of Frenkie de Jong his chances of starting as many games as usual this season appear slim.

But it is thought the 31-year-old doesn't want to move to Manchester for family reasons, and he may be more inclined to either stay in Spain or go back to his native Croatia.

The news would come as a blow to United, who have identified the central midfield position as one which could do with an upgrade in their squad.

(Image: West Ham United FC via Getty Ima)

Although Scott McTominay is impressing, his midfield partner Fred has still not looked anything like the same player United signed from Shakhtar Donetsk in 2018, and the experience and winning attitude of Rakitic could have added a lot.

If a move for Rakitic is unsuccessful United will most likely turn to West Ham's Rice, but with the 19-year-old on a contract which runs until 2024, the England international will not come cheap.
description: The Barcelona midfielder was linked with a move away from the Nou Camp over the summer and could yet leave in January
